title: Drawing, "Competition Design for  La Fenice, Venice: Roof Plan", 1788
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and pink and gray wash, graphite on heavy laid paper.
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: PIANTA DEL TETTO;  at lower right, T.ˆ X; lettered on design, a b/a b/ a b
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli (1845-1926), Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Plan of the roof of theater and annex building: a rectangular roof at left is joined to a horseshoe-shaped roof at right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Competition Design for  La Fenice, Venice: Roof Plan", 1788.
1788. Pen and black ink, brush and pink and gray wash, graphite on heavy laid paper.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-123.
